title: How to Recycle Tube TVs

steps.headline: Drop off the TV at an electronics store with a recycling program.
steps.description: Many stores that sell electronics also recycle them! Some TV manufacturers also have TV recycling programs. Ask a sales associate the next time you’re in the store or search online for retailers and manufacturers that recycle electronics. Then, simply bring the TV to the drop-off point during business hours.

steps.headline: Take the TV to an electronics recycling center near you.
steps.description: Electronics recycling centers reuse valuable materials from the TV, which conserves the energy it would take to mine and manufacture new materials. To find an electronics recycling center in your area, go to http://www.ecyclingcentral.com/. Drop it off during the center’s business hours.

steps.headline: Arrange to have the TV picked up if you don’t mind paying a fee.
steps.description: If the recycling center or retailer is far away or if the TV is too heavy to move by yourself, you can usually pay a fee to have them pick it up for you. Call the nearest electronics recycling center and ask if they offer this option. Expect to pay around $100 for the convenience.

methods.name: Disposing of the TV Other Ways

steps.headline: Advertise the TV for free on classified sites.
steps.description: Some people actually collect old tube TVs. Not only are they cheap, they can still be connected to satellite and cable boxes. Older video games also look better on tube TVs. If your TV still works, make an ad on Craigslist or a similar site stating that you are willing to give the TV away to someone who will come pick it up.

steps.headline: Donate the TV to a nonprofit organization as an alternative.
steps.description: If the TV still works, you can donate it to a nonprofit group like the Salvation Army. Do an online search to find such an organization near you. Then, call the center to make sure they accept old TVs. If they do, drop it off at the center or arrange to have it picked up. Donations like these are a tax write-off so don’t forget to get a receipt.

steps.headline: Don’t just throw the TV away.
steps.description: Tube TVs are full of toxic materials, like lead and cadmium. If you throw them away, the toxins leach out into the ground and harm the environment. Plus, if you’re caught dumping electronics in the trash, you could end up paying a hefty fine.

steps.headline: Turn the TV into a fish tank.
steps.description: You can give an old TV new life by repurposing it. For instance, you can make the TV an aquarium! Clear out all the old parts behind the glass and place a fish tank into the TV housing. Take care to dispose of the old parts correctly, rather than throwing them away. Look for tutorials online if you need help with this project.

steps.headline: Make a mini bar out of the TV.
steps.description: Rather than getting rid of the TV, you can turn it into a functional and beautiful display. Clear out the inside of the TV so you can arrange liquor bottles and decanters inside it in a unique way. This would look great in a man cave or basement bar.

steps.headline: Convert the TV into a pet bed.
steps.description: There’s tons of tutorials for turning old TVs and desktop computers into pet beds online! If you have a little furry friend, you can make them a customized bed from your old TV. Be sure to remove all the parts and wires, and place a cushion in the bottom for maximum comfort.
